channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Some of the things Gaza needs: A government, security and tools to rebuild
item.description: A shaky ceasefire is holding. Now the Palestinian territory is in urgent need of a functioning government, order on the streets, and resources to star...

item.title: Targets of Trump's Justice Department must pay up, even if they win
item.description: For defendants facing criminal charges from the Justice Department, the costs of fighting are enormous and can reverberate for years, according to vet...

item.title: 80-year-old grandmother becomes oldest woman to finish the Ironman World Championship
item.description: Just 20 years ago, Natalie Grabow was learning to swim. Now she's hailed as an inspiration after winning her age group at the famously grueling triath...

item.title: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuelan drug trade. And, judge pauses shutdown layoffs
item.description: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuela by authorizing covert CIA operations. And, a federal judge halts the Trump administration's shutdown layoffs.

item.title: Health insurance premiums are going up next year — unless you work at these companies
item.description: As U.S. health insurance costs rise, some companies are paying for all of their workers' premiums. It's a big expense — but they say it pays off.

item.title: India casts doubt on Trump's claim Modi will stop buying Russian oil
item.description: The Indian government says it is "not aware" of a call in which the US president claimed India's leader made the commitment.

item.title: As the shutdown drags on, these people will lose if health care subsidies expire
item.description: Millions of Americans with Affordable Care Act marketplace health insurance will face higher costs next year if Congress doesn’t extend enhanced premi...

item.title: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde opens up on courage and faith in new book
item.description: The Right Reverend Mariann Edgar Budde, leader of Washington's Episcopal Diocese, joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss her book for young readers, "We Can ...

item.title: Keith Urban and Blake Shelton team up for new CBS music competition, "The Road"
item.description: "The Road," CBS' new musical competition series, follows 12 emerging country artists competing for $250,000, a record deal, and a chance to perform at...

item.title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals
item.description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, we show you items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage...

item.title: Kenya police fire shots and tear gas at crowds gathered to see body of ex-PM Odinga
item.description: The crowds were so big that the public viewing was moved from the parliament building to a stadium.

item.title: Clashes between police and Gen Z protesters in Peru leave one dead
item.description: The protests come just days after a new president was sworn in following Dina Boluarte's impeachment.

item.title: Who’s winning the blame game over the shutdown? Here’s what a new AP-NORC poll shows
French PM survives major test but breathing space will not last long
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu survives two confidence votes in parliament and can now focus on passing the 2026 budget.

item.title: Prominent Palestinian prisoner Marwan Barghouti attacked by guards, family says
item.description: The alleged attack on the 66-year-old is said to have left him unconscious. Israel's prison service called the claim "fake".

item.title: Government shutdown live updates as Senate holds 10th vote to fund government
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune plans to bring up the full-year defense spending bill today for a test vote after holding the 10th vote to fund the ...

item.title: Hamas says it has handed over all hostage remains it can recover amid destruction in Gaza
item.description: Hamas said it has handed over all of the bodies of Israeli hostages that it can and needs specialized equipment to retrieve the remaining ones.

item.title: Alaska airlifting hundreds from storm-devastated coastal villages
